imClasses package¶

Submodules¶

imClasses.Atd module¶

Class for arrival time distributions (ATD) - plotting, peak identification and calculations.

class imClasses.Atd.Atd[source]¶

Bases: msClasses.TwoDdata.TwoDdata

autoAxisX(ax, limit=0.1, percExtra=10, ccsAxisValues=False)[source]¶

Automatically crop the x axis of the axes instance.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib.axes() object
  • limit – highest value allowed to be excluded (1 = 1% of BPI)
  • percExtra – how far past the limit values to set axis limits
  • ccsAxisValues – Provide to use CCS axis instead of td.
Returns:

None
autoAxisXoff(ax, ccsAxisValues=False)[source]¶

Revert axis limits to original values.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib.axes() object
  • ccsAxisValues – Provide to use CCS axis instead of td.
Returns:

None
plot(ax, **kwargs)[source]¶

Overwrites TwoDdata()’s function to get axis labels right Can take matplotlib axes object, as well as any standard inputs for matplotlib.pyplot.plot().

plotCcs(ax, ccsAxis, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot a CCS distribution, handles figure labelling.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib axes instance or False
  • ccsAxis – CCS axis which corresponds to the arrival time axis
  • **kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments
Returns:

None
setAtdXvals(xvals)[source]¶

Set the x axis values for the object.

Parameters:yvals – Arrival time values for the Atd() object
Returns:None
setAtdYvals(yvals)[source]¶

Set the y axis values for the object.

Parameters:yvals – Intensity values for the Atd() object
Returns:None

imClasses.Calibrant module¶

Class for ion mobility protein calibrant data and analysis.

class imClasses.Calibrant.Calibrant(proteinName, folderName, peakFwhm=10)[source]¶
generateCorrectedTdsAndCcss(waveVelocity, gas='Nitrogen')[source]¶

Calculate td prime and CCS prime, using the calibration equations including the reduced mass equation. :parameter waveVelocity: Velocity in m/s :parameter gas: Mobililty gas used (default: ‘Nitrogen’)

getCcssPrime()[source]¶

Calculate CCS’‘. :returns: List of CCS’’ values

getChargeTdsDict()[source]¶

Get a dictionary for the arrival time values for each charge state specified in self.charges. :returns: Dictionary of form d[ChargeState] = arrival time

getTdsDoublePrime()[source]¶

Calculate td’‘. :returns: List of td’’ values

plotCalibrantTdPeaks(ax, colourList=0)[source]¶

Plot the arrival time values which are to be used in calibration (usually using the ATD apex as the time value). :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter colourList: List of colours to use or 0/False to use defaults

plotChargeStateAtds(ax, lift=0, colourList=0, charges=0, smoothing=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the arrival time distributions for the charge states of the calibrant. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instances :parameter lift: Vertical spacing between traces :parameter colourList: List of colours to use or 0/False to use defaults :parameter charges: List of charges to display (or 0 to display all) :parameter smoothing: Boolean; whether or not to smooth the ATDs :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib.pyplot compatible commands for mass spectrum

plotMsAndExtractionLimits(ax, colourList=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the calibrant’s mass spectrum on the supplied axes and shade in the areas which is to be used for extraction of arrival time data. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instances :parameter colourList: List of colours to use or 0/False to use defaults :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib.pyplot compatible commands for mass spectrum

setCharges(charges)[source]¶

Set the charges for the species. (Used for ATD extraction). :parameter charges: List of charge states (int)

setPeakFwhm(fwhm)[source]¶

Set the m/z width to be used for extracting arrival time information and update the extraction. :parameter fwhm: Peak full width half maximum (m/z)

setPeakFwhmMultipliers(leftMultiplier, rightMultiplier)[source]¶

Set values to multiply the m/z value peak width for the lower and upper boundary for arrival time extraction. (Then update td data) :parameter leftMultiplier: Multiply by the peak width lower than the mean :parameter rightMultiplier: Multiply by the peak width above the mean

setTdValue(td, z)[source]¶

Set the arrival time value for a particular charge state. :parameter td: Arrival time value for peak (usually apex) :parameter z: Charge state

imClasses.Calibration module¶

Class for calculating travelling wave ion mobility calibration curves for converting arrival time into collision cross section.

class imClasses.Calibration.Calibration[source]¶
addCalibrant(calibrantObj)[source]¶

Add a calibrant (which is another protein or charge state) to the calibration.

Parameters:calibrantObj – A Calibrant() object
apply1dCalibration(mzs, tds, charge)[source]¶

Converts the arrival time values (tds) to collision cross section (CCS). Usually used to convert the arrival time axis directly into CCS. Can also be used to calculate individual points.

Parameters:
  • mzs – numpy array or float
  • tds – numpy array or float
  • charge – integer value for charge
createCalibration(waveVelocity, gas='Nitrogen')[source]¶

Calculate a calibration curve.

Parameters:
  • waveVelocity – IM cell wave velocity (m/s)
  • gas – ‘Nitrogen’ or ‘Helium’, used to calculate reduced mass
getCcsAxisGrid(mzs, tds, charge)[source]¶

CCS calibration is dependent on m/z and td, so this calculates the CCS values associated with the matrix of intensity values in the 3 dimensional data.

Parameters:
  • mzs – numpy array
  • tds – numpy array
  • charge – integer value for charge
pickle(filename)[source]¶

Serialise the calibration data for future use using cPickle.

Parameters:filename – Absolute path and filename to use to save the pickle.
plotCalibrationCurve(ax, colourList=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot graph of the calibration including the R^2 value.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib.axes.Axes() object
  • colourList – List of matplotlib colours to use. If False default colours are used
  • **kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments
removeCalibrant(calibrantName)[source]¶

Remove a calibrant from the calibration.

Parameters:calibrantName – Name of calibrant to be removed (dictionary key)

imClasses.CcsD module¶

Class for collision cross section distributions (CCSDs) - plotting, peak identification and calculations.

Bases: msClasses.TwoDdata.TwoDdata

Parameters:
  • calibrationOb – Calibration() object for converting ATD to CCSD
  • dataSlice – DataSlice() object containing the data for the CCSD

imClasses.DataSlice module¶

Class for handling a portion of an IM dataset. Usually is used for holding the data within a signle mass spectrum charge state peak.

class imClasses.DataSlice.DataSlice[source]¶

Bases: imClasses.ImData.ImData

ccsd = None¶

self.xaxis = [] self.yaxis = [] self.matrix = [] self.matrixUnaltered = [] self.xlims = [] self.ylims = []

self.ccsMatrix # dno where from

self.atd = Atd.Atd() self.massSpectrum = MassSpectrum.MassSpectrum()

generateCcsAxisAndGrid(calibrationObj, ccsInterval=1)[source]¶

Create CCS axis which corresponds to the intensity information of an arrival time distribution, also create CCS grid which provides the CCS value for each datapoint in the intensity matrix.

Parameters:
  • calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object (IM calibration)
  • ccsInterval – Spacing between each CCS value in Angstrom**2
generateCcsDistribution(calibrationObj)[source]¶

Create a CcsD() out of this object’s data.

Parameters:calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object
Returns:imClasses.CcsD() object
getAtdApex()[source]¶

Get the arrival time value for the point of highest intensity. Get the highest point of the arrival time distribution.

Returns:Arrival time of maximum intensity (float)
getAtdPeaks(smoothes, window_len, limit=0)[source]¶

Find peaks using gradient method.

Returns:atdPeaks (list of arrival time values)
getCcsDistribution(calibrationObj)[source]¶

Convert the matrix into CCS, sum it and return the intensity values for the CCS distribution.

Parameters:calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object
Returns:ccsLine (CCS distribution y axis values)
getCcsMatrix(calibrationObj)[source]¶

Use calibration to create a grid of CCS values associated with each entry in the intensity matrix.

Parameters:calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object (IM calibration)
Returns:CCS matrix, x axis and y axis (all numpy arrays)
getCcsPeaks(smoothes, window_len, mz, calibrationOb, limit=0)[source]¶

Smooth data then find peaks using the gradient method in the arrival time distribution. Convert the arrival time values to CCS.

Parameters:
  • smoothes – Number of rounds of Savitzky-Golay smoothing
  • window_len – Savitzky-Golay smoothing window size (size used is window_len*2 + 1)
  • mz – m/z value to use for CCS conversion
  • calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object
  • limit – Percentage of base peak under which to ignore peaks found
Returns:

ccsPeaks (list of CCS values)
getData()[source]¶

Get the intensity matrix, m/z axis and arrival time axis.

Returns:matrix, x axis, y axis (all numpy arrays)
getMsApex()[source]¶

Get the m/z value for the point of highest intensity.

Returns:m/z value (float)
getMsApexI()[source]¶

Get index of the m/z axis for the point of highest intensity.

Returns:index
getMsApexProportion()[source]¶

Relative to width of the slice e.g. 0.5 for in the middle

Returns:proportion of axis (float)
plotCcsDistribution(ax, calibrationObj, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the CCS distribution for this DataSlice.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib axes instance or False
  • calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object (IM calibration)
  • **kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments

imClasses.Im module¶

Class for holding full ion mobility data files, containing data for multiple charge states.

class imClasses.Im.Im[source]¶

Bases: imClasses.ImData.ImData

calculateAtdStatistics(speciesName, charge)[source]¶

Calculate the weighted mean and standard deviation for an arrival time distribution. :parameter speciesName: Name of molecular species :parameter charge: Charge state to use :returns: average, standard deviation

calculateCcsdStatistics(speciesName, charge)[source]¶

Calculate the weighted mean and standard deviation for a CCS distribution. :parameter speciesName: Name of molecular species :parameter charge: Charge state to use :returns: average, standard deviation

calculateStatistics(twoDdata)[source]¶

Calculate the weighted mean and standard deviation :parameter twoDdata: An object which inherits from msClasses.TwoDdata() (e.g. MassSpectrum() or Atd()). :returns: average, standard deviation

generateCcsAxesAndGrids(calibrationObj, ccsInterval=1)[source]¶

Calibrate the ion mobility data by calculating CCS equivalents of the arrival time data. :parameter calibrationObj: imClasses.Calibration() object :parameter ccsInterval: Interval in Angstrom**2 to use for interpolation of the calibrated arrival time axes.

generateSpeciesSlicesExplicit(limitDic)[source]¶

Create data slices using explicit m/z limits for arrival time data extraction, for all supplied species and charge states. :parameter limitDic: d[species][z] = [lowerLimit,upperLimit]

generateSpeciesSlicesFwhm(speciesName, leftMultiplier=1, rightMultiplier=1)[source]¶

Create data slices using peak width from mass spectrum fit for a specific species. :parameter speciesName: Name of molecular species :parameter leftMultiplier: Value to multiply the peak fwhm below the mean :parameter rightMultiplier: Value to multiply the peak fwhm above the mean

getAtd(speciesName, charge, normalised=True)[source]¶

Get the arrival time distribution for the specific charge state of a species. :parameter speciesName: Name of molecular species :parameter charge: Charge state to use :parameter normalised: Boolean for whether to normalise data to base peak intensity :returns: imClasses.Atd() object

getDataSlice(speciesName, charge)[source]¶

Get the section of the data related to this charge state of this species. :parameter speciesName: Name of molecular species :parameter charge: Charge state to use :returns: imClasses.DataSlice() object

getDataSlices()[source]¶

Get all available data slices. :returns: Dictionary of imClasses.DataSlice() objects in the form d[speciesName][chargeState] = DataSlice()

labelChargeStateContourPlots(ax, species)[source]¶

Annotate 3D Clemmer-style contour plots with charge state numbering. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter species: The molecular species to be labelled

loadAmphiFile(filename)[source]¶

Load data from amphitrite data file (‘.a’). :parameter filename: Absolute path to data file

loadFolder(folderPath)[source]¶

Load data from text files. Files should be named ‘MassMobilityXaxis.txt’ for the m/z axis, ‘MassMobilityYaxis.txt’ for arrival time axis and ‘MassMobility.txt’ for the matrix of intensities. :parameter folderPath: Absolute path to directory containing text files.

loadFolderAuto(folderName)[source]¶

Automatically carries out the processing depending on what is input. If the folder is MassLynx raw data file, it will detect and process that (windows only), if the folder contains correctly named text files it will do the same. Finally if the folderName points to an Amphitrite data file (‘.a’) it will detect this and process accordingly. :parameter folderName: Absolute path to data folder or file

loadMsFit(filename)[source]¶

Load and set the Amphitrite mass spectrum fit from file. (Erases currently set mass spectrum data). :parameter filename: Absolute path to pickled msClasses.MassSpectrum() object (‘.afit’ file).

loadRawFolder(rawPath, grain=2)[source]¶

Load data from MassLynx raw data set. :parameter rawPath: Path to raw data directory :parameter grain: m/z spacing for extracting the data (minimum 0.5).

plotAtdSlicesHeatMap(ax)[source]¶

Draw 3D contour plots showing each dataslice. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance

plotCcsHeatMap(ax, calibrationOb, **kwargs)[source]¶

Draw a 3D m/z against CCS contour plot. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter calibrationOb: imClasses.Calibration() object :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib imshow compatible arguments

plotCcsHeatMapFromDataSlices(ax, calibrationOb, dataSlices, **kwargs)[source]¶

Draw a 3D m/z against CCS contour plot given dataSlices. (Used when you don’t want to plot all dataSlices available). :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter calibrationOb: imClasses.Calibration() object :parameter dataSlices: Dictionary of imClasses.DataSlice() objects (d[chargeState] = dataSlice) :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib imshow compatible arguments

plotChargeStateAtd(ax, speciesName, charge, colour='gray', normalise='bpi', label='', lift=0, smoothing=0, window_len=3, smoothes=1, poly_order=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Draw the arrival time distribution of a particular charge state of a species. :parameter ax: matplotlib.axes.Axes() object :parameter speciesName: Name of species :parameter charge: Charge state :parameter colour: Matplotlib.pyplot compatible colour :parameter normalise: Normalisation method; base peak intensity (‘bpi’) or per area (‘area’). :parameter label: Label to be used in legend :parameter lift: Absolute value to lift the trace vertically (used for stacking multiple ATDs :parameter smoothing: Boolean for Savitzky Golay smoothing :parameter window_len: Window size for smoothing :parameter poly_order: Polynormial to use for smoothing :parameter **kwargs: matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments

plotChargeStateAtds(ax, speciesName, charges=0, lift=0, colourList=0, smoothing=0, window_len=3, smoothes=1, poly_order=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Draw the arrival time distribution of all (or given) charge states of a species. :parameter ax: matplotlib.axes.Axes() object :parameter speciesName: Name of species :parameter charges: List of charges to use (or 0/False to use all charges) :parameter colour: Matplotlib.pyplot compatible colour :parameter lift: Absolute value to separate ATDs vertically :parameter smoothing: Boolean for Savitzky Golay smoothing :parameter window_len: Window size for smoothing :parameter poly_order: Polynormial to use for smoothing :parameter **kwargs: matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments

plotChargeStateContourPeaktops(ax, calibrationOb, species, smths, wlen, colour='b', limit=0, dataType='ccs', **kwargs)[source]¶

For contour plots in Clemmer-style charge state mode; plots the peak tops as found using derivative. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter calibrationOb: imClasses.Calibration() object :parameter species: Name of molecular species to use :parameter smths: Rounds of smoothing to do before picking peaks :parameter wlen: Window length for smoothing (Savitzky Golay) :parameter colour: Colour for peak top markers :parameter dataType: Either CCS (‘ccs’) or arrival time (‘std’) :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib scatter compatible arguments

plotChargeStateContourPlots(ax, calibrationOb, species, **kwargs)[source]¶

Draw 3D Clemmer-style contour plots given species name. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter calibrationOb: imClasses.Calibration() object :parameter species: Species name :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib imshow compatible arguments

plotChargeStateContourPlotsFromDataSlices(ax, calibrationOb, dataSlices, species, **kwargs)[source]¶

Draw 3D Clemmer-style contour plots from provided dataSlices. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter calibrationOb: imClasses.Calibration() object :parameter dataSlices: Dictionary of imClasses.DataSlice() objects (d[chargeState] = dataSlice) :parameter species: The molecular species the dataSlices are from :parameter **kwargs: Matplotlib imshow compatible arguments

plotMsExtractionLimits(ax, speciesName, colourList=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Fill in the area between the max and min limits of FWHM around the peak mean. :parameter ax: Matplotlib Axes instance :parameter speciesName: Species name :parameter colourList: List of matplotlib colours to use. If False default colours are used :parameter **kwargs: matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments

setDataFromAmphiExtract(dataList)[source]¶

Set the m/z and arrival time axis as well as the intensity matrix from a list of those arrays. :parameter dataList: List of form [xaxis,yaxis,intensityArray]

setMsFit(msOb)[source]¶

Set the Amphitrite mass spectrum fit, and as a by product, the species objects. :parameter msOb: msClasses.MassSpectrum() object

setSpecies(species)[source]¶

Add a species object to the self.species dictionary. :parameter species: msClasses.Species() object

imClasses.ImData module¶

Class for describing ion mobility data. This is used for both small sections of the full set of mobility data (DataSlice) and whole datasets (its the superclass of Im()).

class imClasses.ImData.ImData[source]¶
generateAtd()[source]¶

Sum the intensity matrix to create an arrival time distribution.

generateMassSpectrum(keepExisting=True)[source]¶

Sum the intensity matrix to create a mass spectrum.

Parameters:keepExisting – if True don’t overwrite exisiting mass spectrum for this object
getMassSpectrum(keepExisting=True)[source]¶

Sum the intensity matrix to create a mass spectrum and return it.

Parameters:keepExisting – If False recreate the mass spectrum before returning it
Returns:msClasses.MassSpectrum() object
limitAxisX(lims)[source]¶

Set limits for the m/z axis.

Parameters:lims – list in format of [lower,upper] limits
limitAxisY(lims)[source]¶

Set limits for the arrival time axis.

Parameters:lims – list in format of [lower,upper] limits
normalisationArea()[source]¶

Normalise intensity matrix to the area under the matrix.

Calculation is done by dividing by the sum of the intensity matrix and multipling by the number of entries.

normalisationBpi()[source]¶

Normalise intensity matrix to the peak height at its highest point.

normalisationBpiByMs()[source]¶

Not implemented yet.

plotHeatmap(ax=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot a heatmap of this object’s data.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib Axes instance or boolean
  • **kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments
plotHeatmapFromMatrix(matrix, x, y, ax=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a heatmap from provided information instead of using this object’s properties.

Parameters:
  • matrix – numpy array (intensity data)
  • x – numpy array (m/z axis)
  • y – numpy array (arrival time axis)
  • ax – matplotlib Axes instance or boolean
  • **kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments

Set x (m/z) axis

Parameters:x – numpy array
setAxisY(y)[source]¶

Set y (arrival time) axis

Parameters:y – numpy array
setMatrix(matrix)[source]¶

Set the matrix of intensity values (which aligns with the x and y axes).

Parameters:matrix – numpy array (2D)

Convenience function with calls matplotlib.pyplot.show().

imClasses.SpecialFigures module¶

class imClasses.SpecialFigures.SpecialFigures[source]¶
atDistributions(ax, imObj, spName=0, colourList=0, lift=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

ccsDistributions(ax, imObj, calibrationObj, spName=0, ccsInterval=1, colourList=0, lift=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Extract arrival time distributions for each charge state of a species, convert to CCS and plot them vertically stacked.

Parameters:
  • ax – matplotlib Axes instance
  • imObj – imClasses.Im() object
  • calibrationObj – imClasses.Calibration() object (IM calibration)
  • spName – Name of molecular species to use from imObj
  • ccsInterval – Spacing of CCS values in Angstrom**2
  • colourList – List of matplotlib compatible colours to use
  • **kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot.plot() arguments
